reference.title: euca_conf

row.entry: Begin the one-time initialization of the CLC
Return heartbeat data for the specified host
Do not use rsync when registering
Do not use scp when registering

Download credentials to the specified zip file. By default, the admin credentials will be downloaded but this can be adjusted with the --cred-user option. Each time this is called, new X.509 certificates will be created for the specified user.
Set get-credentials for the specified account
Set get-credentials for the specified user
Add new Cloud Controller to Eucalyptus
Add a Cluster Controller to Eucalyptus
Remove a Cluster Controller from Eucalyptus
Used with --register-* to skip syncing keys
Point Eucalyptus to the specified directory What does this mean?
Set the Cluster Controller to the specified port
Set the Storage Controller to the specified port
Set Walrus to the specified port
Set the Node Controller to the specified port
Set the instance path More about instances and paths?

Set which hypervisor to use.
Valid values: xen | kvm
Set the user to use for EUCA_USER More info needed.
Set the DHCP daemon binary to the specified path path to the DCHCP daemon?
Set the specified user name to run dhcpd as
Set the bridge as the specified name name? type?
Returns the value for the specified name Example?
Import variables from a specified eucalyptus.conf file
Upgrade eucalyptus.conf from the specified older installation file
Perform initial setup More information or cautions?

Enable specified service at next start
Valid values: cloud | walrus | sc | vmwarebroker No cc?

Disable specified service at next start
Valid values: cloud | walrus | sc | vmwarebroker No cc?

Pre-flight checks More info?
Valid values: common | vmware
Name of partition. Used with --register-* and --deregister-*
Name or IP address of host. Used with --register-*
Name of the component. Used with --register-* and --deregister-*
Region to direct requests to. Only valid for EC2 endpoints. Meaning what?
URL of the cloud to connect to. Expects an EC2 endpoint /services/Eucalyptus. What does this sentence mean?

Read credentials and cloud settings from the specified config file.
Default: $HOME/.eucarc or /etc/euca2ools/eucarc.
Prints what the command sends to the server and what it receives from the server. Use when you're trying to debug Euca2ools.
Display the manual page for the command.
Display the version of this tool
